lines.text:
[to Christabel]
I love you so much I wish I liked you.
Do you think my husband would like a picture of me hanging above the fireplace?
I think your husband would like you hanging anywhere.

[to Christabel]
I don't make dates with other men's wives unless they bring written permission from their husbands.
Why don't you marry me and quit getting lost
Nick!
That's no answer.
Oh I can't darling, I need time, give me a little time.
All right, I won't push you. I'll give you till tommorow night.
You love only one person in the world Christabel, and it's the love of a lifetime.
I've always wanted to know someone who went to China, tell me about it.
A lot of Chinese live there.
Hello, Nick. I thought your plane left at twelve?
It did. They have a habit of leaving whether I'm on them or not.
What a swell farewell party. We said goodbye to everything, including the lining in my stomach.

[to Christabel]
How many times do I have to tell you how much you love me?
You don't care very much for women, do you?
My dear girl, apart from painting my major occupation is convincing women's husbands that I'm harmless.
I want you to invest in something terrific.
Invest in what?
In me, of course. I want to have a one-man show late this summer. August, maybe. It'll cost about 500 dollars. But what's money?
Mine or yours?
Yours, of course. I have none.

[smiling]
Well, don't be so smug about it.

[to Gobby, as they both look at Gobby's painting of Christabel]
Looks like a cross between Lucrezia Borgia and Peg o' my heart. Even with two heads you couldn't look like this - or do you know something I don't?

[to Christabel]
I can just hear you, being so helpful - and so helpless. Helping to mess up people's lives for your own selfish purposes. And just about as "helpless" as a wildcat. Somebody should have told the birds and bees about *you*!
I suppose no one ever died of a broken heart.

[to Christabel]
You little fake. Don't you know what you really want? Make up your mind, and make it up now, because I'm a restless guy.

[to Christabel]
Sorry, I'm not cut out to be a backstreet boy.

[to Donna]
I made a big mistake when I gave up flying. Maybe I'm one of those people who has to back away from things to see them clearly. Because once I'm up in that plane, all by myself, I can look down and see things as they really are - in their true proportions. The big and important things look big. And the little, dirty things look like... just that.

[to Christabel, as she's moving her belongings out of Curtis' house]
Now, what about the furniture?
I wouldn't want anything that belonged to Curtis. It would only remind me of... happier times.

[the butler comes out with a large armload of expensive fur coats and puts them in her car]
Won't those remind you... just a little?

[coyly]
I'll simply have to force myself.
